A December to Remember at the Riverfront Esplanade is a multi-day extravaganza, starting November 29, filled with community events, a movie on the lawn, holiday bazaar, Santa sightings, live music, and so much more! Join us in celebrating the holidays together during a December you surely won’t forget! Holiday Bazaar & Santa Sightings DECEMBER 6, 13, & 20 | 6-9PM | 179 S. Beach St. Support local, small businesses while shopping at our 'Holiday Bazaar' during 'A December to Remember at the Riverfront Esplanade! Taking place Friday, December 6, 13, & 20 from 6-9pm! Stop by Santa’s booth to get your holiday picture as well! Holiday Walk/Run DECEMBER 6  |  6PM  |  105 Jackie Robinson Pkwy. Experience 'A December to Remember' at the Riverfront Esplanade in Downtown Daytona Beach with our third annual Holiday Walk/Run taking place on Friday, December 6th at 6pm! Festive Pajamas encouraged! Dress up in your best holiday gear and enjoy beautiful waterfront views while walking the holiday light display! Entry is FREE! Click here to register! Mini Jingle Jam DECEMBER 13TH | 6PM-7:30PM | 255 S. Beach St. Join us for HRT's Mini Jingle Jam taking place on Friday, December 13 from 6-7:30pm!  Where you will hear festive holiday songs performed by some of Halifax Repertory Theatre singers to help get you into the holiday spirit! Howliday Pet Parade DECEMBER 18TH | 5:30-7:30PM | 105 Jackie Robinson Pkwy. Experience our third annual Howliday Pet Parade! Well behaved pups are welcome! Dress up your pup while you walk in the parade! Best Dressed, Most Creative and Judge’s Favorite awards will be given out by our three judges of the parade! Enjoy beautiful waterfront views, walk the holiday light display, and support our local pet vendors! Entry is free but we ask that you bring a cash donation or donation of pet food, supplies, beds, etc for Pawsibilities Rescue Group based in Port Orange! Click here to register! Holiday Movie - The Polar Express DECEMBER 20TH | 6PM | 255 S. Beach St. Free Community Movie in the Rose Garden on Friday, December 20th featuring The Polar Express! Guests can bring their blankets and lawn chairs to watch the movie. Coolers are not allowed. Refreshments will be available for purchase. Want to become a vendor for our Holiday Bazaar? Download our Vendor Application below and email your completed version to: marketing@riverfrontesplanade.com HOLIDAY BAZAAR VENDOR APPLICATION DOWNLOAD VENDOR APPLICATION Vendor Applications will be reviewed by the Riverfront Esplanade. Applicants will be notified by email on approval status. THANK YOU TO OUR ADTR SPONSORS WANT TO PARTICIPATE IN A DECEMBER TO REMEMBER? Name * First Name Last Name Phone * (###) ### #### Email * How would you like to participate? * Thank you! WANT TO HOST A PRIVATE HOLIDAY EVENT? About Us - The Esplanade Association Visit Us Welcome Know Before You Go Map & Directions ESPLANADE FAQs DCR Park Rules Things To Do Calendar of Events Recreational Areas Playgrounds Programs Fitness Classes Guided Tours Concerts Boston Landmarks Orchestra Concerts GroundBeat Music Concert Series Children in the Park Music and Movement Esplanade 5K & Walk International Moves & Food Volunteer Volunteer Opportunities Charles River Cleanup Group Volunteer Days Volunteer Photographer Program Volunteer Ambassador Program Public Art Open Requests for Proposals About Us About Us EA Mission Climate Action DEIA Statement Our Team and Careers Partnership with DCR Park History What EA Does Park Care Tree Care Organic Land Care Park Maintenance Advocacy Accomplishments Support Donate Now Annual Giving Join Our Community Boston Marathon Team Sponsor Flowers, Trees, Benches Leadership Circle Ways To Give Moondance Gala Connect Contact Publications Press Coverage EA Blog Charlesbank Click to open the search input field Click to open the search input field Search Menu Menu Making life better on the Esplanade About the Esplanade Association Founded in 2001, the Esplanade Association is the non-profit dedicated to revitalizing, enhancing, programming, and maintaining the historic Charles River Esplanade in downtown Boston. The Esplanade is a 64-acre park revered for its natural & cultivated beauty, riverfront access, miles of populated running trails, and thoughtful programming. In the last few years, the Esplanade Association completed planning studies in pathway safety, tree succession, invasives management, and interpretive services while partnering to launch a new beer garden, producing dozens of high-quality events, and much more. The Esplanade Association was formed in 2001 because the park had fallen into a state of decline, and local community members recognized the need for a park friends group that could help to restore and enhance the Esplanade. Since our founding EA has been the catalyst for over $28 million in park improvements. This work has been accomplished in collaboration with the Department of Conservation and Recreation. We invite you to explore the Esplanade Association’s website to learn more about what we do, and how you can help. We look forward to seeing you on the Esplanade! What We Do The Esplanade Association works with volunteers, members, donors, and community partners to ensure that the park remains a resource for everyone to enjoy. Park Projects With the help of supporters and community partners we have successfully completed major capital projects including rebuilding the boating docks, building new playgrounds, revitalizing the Eliot Memorial, and restoring the Hatch Shell Oval lawn. Park Care We employ three full-time horticulturists who help to green and beautify the park using sustainable landscape practices. In addition we host 2,000 volunteers each year to assist with landscape care, trash removal, and general maintenance. Programs We  offer free community-enriching programs such as outdoor group fitness classes throughout the year (yes, even in winter!), free concerts, Guided Tours of the park, and summer field days that bring almost 1,000 youth from under-resourced areas around Boston to enjoy a day of outdoor recreation on the Esplanade. Advocacy We advocate for additional public and private resources for improved park access and connections to the surrounding neighborhoods, for the restoration of parkland and horticulture, and for improved park amenities. We also monitor projects with potential negative impact on the park. Working in partnership with the Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation Sign up for email news 575 Boylston Street, Suite 4R Boston, MA 02116 617-227-0365 © 2025 Esplanade Association Site Credits Copyright info@esplanade.org Link to Facebook Link to X Link to Instagram Staff Privacy Contact Us Scroll to top Scroll to top Scroll to top
